intro: Melampyrum pratense f. hartlii, commonly known as the Hartlii burnet, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has a creeping habit, with slender stems that often lie close to the ground. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. This fern-like plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
